Newton (Bagdad) list December, 1940. 8i 1 mwmmmm INDIA DIRECT0 ft v M C 00-p 19 41j 01st December, 1940. .15 p.m.j ' 5th February, 1941. ccccccc Addressed to Kabul unnumbered of 31st December, 1940* Iraqi Legation at Angora has reported that Iraqi transit visa has been granted to Nasir Shaabad at the renuest of his Ambassado r who has dismissed him on suspicion of undertaking activities against present regime at Kabul. His Ambassador has also asked that his activities while in Iraq should be watched and that he should not be allowed to leave Iraq pending instructions from Kabul. Instructions have been issued accordingly. Repeated to Foreign Office No.. 78 Saying, Government of India No. 21 Saving, Angora No. 16 Saving, en clair ’ ° y bag ‘ f With tb/Compliment. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence is arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the volume.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 3; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains a telegram from HM Ambassador to Iraq to the Foreign Office, informing that instructions have been issued regarding the surveillance and restriction on movement within Iraq of an individual named Nasir Shaabad.
